intro: Oxygonum alatum f. linearilanceolatum, commonly known as the variegated arrowleaf, is a unique variant of the arrowleaf plant. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are often variegated with white or yellow markings. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is native to South America. Its foliage is typically arranged alternately along the stem, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers. This form is prized for its striking leaf patterns and is often cultivated as an ornamental plant.
